column3: str
Alphinaud seems satisfied that he and Watt are of one mind.
Wait inside the gate to the Ala Mhigan Quarter.
Speak with Raubahn.
Speak with Lyse.
（★未使用／削除予定★）
Grandad and his friends are already hard at work─the rest of us can do no less, eh?
It seems Wiscar has the Saltery's security well in hand. I, meanwhile, have discussed the next steps with Master Watt, and completed my inspection of the site.
With a little work, the vacant buildings here could be made into very presentable dwellings.
Message from General Aldynn!
Apologies for the interruption, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>, but the General would speak with you at your earliest convenience!
Do not feel obliged to wait around on my account. I will remain here to hammer out the finer details with Watt, and act as an intermediary with our business partners in Ul'dah. You should go.
General Aldynn asked that you wait for him by the main gate in the Ala Mhigan Quarter. My apologies again, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>! Fare you well!
That Alphinaud's a bright lad, isn't he? I told him what we'd need to repair the place and he tallied up the total cost on the spot─and it weren't a small number, either!
I'll ask Commander Hext to assign a squad to patrol the Saltery's harvesting and fishing spots. And I'll be sure to tell them what you told me!
Pray leave the administrative tasks to me. General Aldynn will be waiting.
I was just on my way to the Saltery─it's lucky I saw you!
Arenvald seems flustered. Something is amiss...
That took longer than I intended, but at least you know where I stand.

Now that's settled...
Arenvald─what news?
We may have a problem, sir.
A group of Ananta has arrived at the main gates. And I don't mean the Vira. These are <Emphasis>Qalyana</Emphasis>─the ones that summoned the primal.
They're insisting they be allowed to attend the council. Lyse is trying to reason with them, but she may need help...
Hmm... An invitation <Emphasis>was</Emphasis> extended to all of the native beast tribes...but we assumed the Qalyana would refuse it out of hand.
We had best go and see for ourselves. Pipin, take command of our forces and be ready for battle.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─you've dealt with these Qalyana before. I'd have you at my side.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Raubahn! Gods, it's good to see you...
Ah! The ssslayer has come.
We have not forgotten how you sssinned againssst the Lady of Blisss...but we did not come here to shed blood.
You claim to ssseek harmony with all who call Gyr Abania home. If thisss is truly your wish, you will welcome usss as envoys of the Ananta!
It <Emphasis>is</Emphasis> our wish, and you <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> welcome. But we cannot condone the summoning of primals.
If you want to enter the palace, I must ask that you first surrender any crystal jewelry. You have my word that it will all be returned to you when the meeting is over.
...We will do as you asssk─but you will not have our weapons. We are not ssso foolish as to place ourssselves <Emphasis>entirely</Emphasis> at the mercy of our tormentors...
I reckon that's the closest we're going to get to a compromise. And we <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> have people standing guard...
Aye, let them keep their swords.
Then we have an agreement. Lead the way to your meeting chamber.
Why do I have the feeling we've welcomed a viper into our midst...?
